prBody:
## Summary

Configured ESLint and Prettier for the lingerie website project with modern tooling and comprehensive code quality setup.

### Changes Made

‚úÖ **Project Setup**
- Created React + Vite project structure with modern dependencies
- Set up Node.js project with proper package.json configuration
- Configured Vite build tool with React plugin and optimization settings

‚úÖ **ESLint Configuration**
- Installed ESLint v9 with modern flat config format (`eslint.config.js`)
- Added React-specific plugins: `react`, `react-hooks`, `react-refresh`
- Included accessibility rules with `jsx-a11y` plugin
- Configured TypeScript parser support for future extensibility
- Integrated Prettier with ESLint to prevent conflicts

‚úÖ **Prettier Configuration**
- Installed Prettier v3 with ESLint integration
- Created `.prettierrc` with project-appropriate settings:
  - Single quotes for JSX
  - Semicolons enabled
  - 2-space indentation
  - 80 character line width
  - ES5 trailing commas
- Added `.prettierignore` to exclude build artifacts and docs

‚úÖ **npm Scripts**
- `npm run lint` - Check code quality with ESLint
- `npm run lint:fix` - Auto-fix ESLint issues
- `npm run format` - Format code with Prettier
- `npm run format:check` - Verify formatting compliance
- `npm run build` - Build for production
- `npm run dev` - Start development server

‚úÖ **Project Structure**
- Created proper directory structure (`src/`, `components/`, `pages/`, etc.)
- Added sample React components to test the setup
- Configured routing with React Router v7
- Set up basic styling with CSS files

‚úÖ **Testing & Verification**
- All linting rules pass without warnings
- Code formatting works correctly
- Build process completes successfully
- Development server ready to run
